intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. impunctatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features basal rosettes of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves and stems are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
